@sillygwailo @Fahrni that's correct.

@AnthonyBaker @TfTHacker We definitely want to interop with all the outliners out there, but you can use the outliner in Drummer, it's an open source project called Concord. Good example code there too. https://t.co/KZ1KxlGpU7
Jeremy Zilar, who used to work at the NY Times, explains the utility of the river of NYT stories. https://t.co/AAdU4xBXWb
Pixy, ‚Äúthe world‚Äôs friendliest flying camera‚Äù. https://t.co/RJ9vz76tAP
How sad for Trae Young, the only thing left to debate about him is his hair. Better luck next year. https://t.co/M5J5WF9IFN
Tesla's stock could fall much further. https://t.co/8Ns2JoODoo
Michigan Republican resigns from GOP post citing 'delusional lies' https://t.co/FkYw5eRXaQ
Schitt‚Äôs Creek is moving from Netflix to Hulu come October. https://t.co/kcjRPNSGWz

I was talking on the phone with a good friend and he said what he really wants is X where X is this. https://t.co/7jlIQNb85Y It might be what you want too. People might be thinking about other ways to get news beyond twitter these days, I hope.

@Amy_VanEs @elipariser @WeAreNew_Public yeah we do -- but you have to think to get it, and act. people don't do that before deciding to pour their energies into a vc-backed platform. another example you're going to regret is the url in the tweet to substack. you should not be giving them that power.

@TaylorLorenz would be interesting to compare the risk of not taking covid precautions with the risk of smoking, for example. it'd be interesting to know if not wearing a mask was the equivalent of smoking 2 packs a day. or taking fentanyl or whatever.
@p_mbanugo @searls search for the error message on google and it'll probably turn up stack exchange links of other devs hitting the same problem.

BTW -- I couldn't believe my ears when I heard @maddow say the other night, in passing, this gem. "assuming the Dems lose congress, as expected" That is like your doctor saying: "If you die of cancer in November, as expected" When you don't even have cancer, knock wood.
People who blame the Dems for things only voters control have their heads up their butts.
@ashur you're talking about a reader that doesn't import or export opml files?
@ashur i don't understand the last part -- "that doesn‚Äôt otherwise support the service"
Does anyone believe that with journalism as it is, we will be able to manage the climate crisis without huge lost of human life.

If you're working on an RSS reader, you should allow users to subscribe to OPML files. It should be a standard feature in RSS reader apps.
If you have questions or comments, this is the place..
https://t.co/ExRBtff7mo
Think of this as a persistent import.
When the OPML file is updated, the changes percolate to all users who subscribe to it.
It's exactly analogous to lists in Twitter (and predate lists in Twitter, btw).
